title: Homestead National Monument of America: Support Your Park
body: Explore This Park    Get Involved     Support Your Park             Support Your Park         Volunteers can be involved in special events, living history, natural resource projects, and much more.   Volunteer  Volunteers are an integral part of the park. You can work with school children, preserve the tall grass prairie, conduct water quality monitoring, research topics, assist with special events as well as light maintenance duties and clerical projects. There are many ways to participate in the volunteer program. Opportunities range from one time activities to long term projects.      Make a Donation Learn about making a monetary or artifact donation to Homestead National Monument of America       Join Our Friends The Friends of Homestead is a non-profit organization that promotes, develops, supports, preserves, and maintains Homestead National Monument of America through funds and other activities.        Erika Shirk, a printmaker, was an Artist-in-Residence at Homestead in 2013.   Become an Artist-in-Residence  Homestead National Monument of America welcomes artists to participate in our sixth year of the Artist-in-Residence program. This is an opportunity to share their inspiration and talent with visitors, live and work at the monument, and interpret the park's natural and cultural resources through their unique creative vision. For more information about this program, click the above link or contact Ranger Molly Watters.        Support Homestead by shopping at our Heritage Center or Education Center bookstores.   Shop  Visit the gift shop at the visitor center to find unique gifts and books. All items found in the bookstore have an educational component and are related to the themes of Homestead National Monument of America.
